argumentText:
We have $a|bc$, so $bc=na$, with $n$ an integer. Dividing both sides by
$a$, we have $$\frac{bc}{a}=n$$ But $\gcd(a,b)=1$ implies $b/a$ is only
an integer if $a=1$. So $$\frac{bc}{a} = b \frac{c}{a} = n$$ which means
$a$ must divide $c$.

Note that this proof relies on the Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic.
The alternative proof of Euclid’s lemma avoids this.
